runs.comm: back of a length, not enough width to cut, Dilshan chops it down into the ground and it bounces towards the keeper
fullish outside off, driven on the up to short cover
there's a sort-of Dil-scoop, an early sighting. Length ball on a fourth-stump line. More a lap-sweep, really, plays it well to find the gap to the right of short fine leg
offcutter, back of a length, coming in towards off stump, Dilshan pushes it to point
another offcutter, a bit fuller, whipped from outside off stump through midwicket
full, swerves a long way into the left-hander, beats his bat and smacks him low on the pad as he looks to whip it into the leg side
again some inswing, good length. This time he swipes it from outside off stump, hits it through midwicket
again looks to play that swipe from outside off, and ends up inside-edging it past his stumps, down to the fine leg boundary. Didn't miss leg stump by much. Ugly runs, but runs nonetheless
shortish, this one slides a long way down the leg side. Perera leaves it alone
short and wide, and that is slapped hard, on the up, over the covers. Just stands tall and smashes it with a horizontal bat
slower ball outside off. Perera presses forward, waits, and dabs it towards backward point
back of a length, comes in to cramp Kusal as he leans back to cut. Chops it down into the ground and it rolls slowly into the backward point region
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away to deep backward square leg
low full-toss on middle stump, and that is dropped by Hafeez at short midwicket. Just swiped at it, across the line, and it went straight to the fielder, an easy chance at waist height
slower ball, a touch short on off stump. Dilshan waits on it and pulls it, swivels through it and beats Hafeez, diving to his right at short midwicket, and into the gap wide of deep square leg
another shortish slower ball, and this time Dilshan has pulled it straight to Hafeez at short midwicket. Didn't go to him as quickly as the previous chance, and he accepted it gratefully
back of a length on off stump, punched confidently to mid-off to get off the mark
slower ball, back of a length, angling across towards off stump. Kusal plays with soft hands towards short cover and calls his partner through for a quick single
lbw appeal, not very confident, as Kusal misses the sweep. Was too full for that, but it was also sliding down leg
another sweep, doesn't quite time it and it rolls down to short fine leg
length ball angling into middle stump, goes with the angle as Jayasuriya presses forward to defend, rolls off the inside edge towards short fine leg
another lbw appeal as Kusal goes for another sweep. This time Malik aborts his appeal quickly, realised there was a big inside-edge
down the track now, and that is well played. Aims down the ground now, nice, full follow-through, gets it into the gap to the right of mid-on
down the track again, this time he doesn't get to the pitch, and chooses to go across the line. Ball doesn't turn, goes with the angle, beats his inside edge, and crashes into off stump
back of a length, angling away from Jayasuriya. He goes for a big, angled-bat slash and the ball beats his top edge
a bit fuller now, and a bit too much width. It's a slower ball, and he spots it, gets forward, and launches it crisply over square cover
this one isn't as full or as wide as the previous ball, and Anwar beats his edge again. Just stood there and threw an angled bat at it

slower ball, angled across towards off stump, and that is superbly played. He saw it early, waited on it, took a half-step away from the line to make some room, and dabbed it nice and fine to the third man boundary

back of a length on middle and off, stands tall, lets it come on, and drops it with soft hands towards point. Shehzad swoops quickly on the ball and flicks it at the stumps, misses. De Silva was diving to make his crease. Could have been close had he hit the stumps
back of a length on middle and off, tucked away towards deep square leg
back of a length close to off stump, chopped down to third man
shortish, rising up towards Jayasuriya's hip. Jumps in the air and plays it down towards short fine leg
lovely length outside off, de Silva pushes at it with an angled bat, just standing there and poking, and the angle and bounce take it past his outside edge
fuller now, on middle stump. Looks to whip it into the leg side and gets a leading edge down to third man
short, cramps him for room on middle and off, pulls it through midwicket but doesn't really time it
short, angling away from de Silva. Leans back to try and uppercut, can't put bat to ball
back of a length outside off, chopped away towards deep point
back of a length outside off, and he stands still and uses his wrists to whip it towards deep midwicket
back of a length, slides on with the angle towards off stump, goes on the back foot and pokes it out to point
fuller now, a bit slower, on middle stump. Looks to whip it towards midwicket, gets a leading edge down to long-off
shuffled across to off stump even before Afridi bowled. It was angling across him and he waited on it to dab it fine towards third man

googly, tossed up outside off. Comes forward to drive through cover and it beats his outside edge. Lovely length, and Rizwan quickly has the bails off. They go up to check on his stumping appeal, but Jayasuriya, having overbalanced a touch, had quickly jammed his back foot back into the crease
back of a length on middle and leg, defended to short midwicket
short ball, steep bounce as it angles across de Silva. He leans back to try and ramp it but can't connect
back of a length outside off, steered to deep point with an open face
short, rising ball, comes in off the pitch, into the left-hander's body. Gets on his toes and dabs it softly towards backward point
full on middle and off and that is a stunning shot. Just stands there and drives through the line, extends the punch and finishes with a high elbow to lift it over mid-off
back of a length outside off, beats the outside edge as he tries to dab it down to third man
another googly, a bit shorter than the one that produced the stumping appeal, and Jayasuriya fails to read this as well, beats his outside edge as he goes back to slash
and again. This time it was an offbreak, and he misread the length and missed connecting with a big drive over cover
back of a length outside off, jabbed away towards short third man

bowled him, that is classic Afridi. How many times have we seen this? Skidded on with the angle, very quickly, and beat the inside edge and rolled off the back thigh into the stumps as de Silva stayed back in his crease to punch through the off side
fullish on middle and off, shows the full face and drives to long-off
back of a length outside off, and Afridi beats Jayasuriya for the 6342463026th time. Goes back to slash it through point, and it turns away from him and goes past his outside edge
full, angling down leg. Plays for turn, looking to whip it into the leg side, and it ricochets off his pad into the leg side
down the track, doesn't get to the pitch of this ball angled in towards off stump, and tucks it quietly into the on side
down the track, heaves across the line, and the ball skids through with the angle, goes past his inside edge, and Rizwan completes a sharp stumping after the ball slides past leg stump
fullish and flat, angling into middle stump. Plays a little early as he looks to clip it into the on side, and it pops up in the air, bounces down towards long-on
back of a length close to off stump, makes room and chops it to point
down the track and Malik smartly pulls his length back. Slides through towards the pads and he brings his bat down quickly to block it
back of a length close to off stump, pushes it with the angle to the right of short cover
full on leg stump and that is nicely done by Jayasuriya. Gets his front leg out of the way and punches it hard, over the umpire's head, and it beats long-off, diving desperately to his left
tossed up wide outside off and it beats Jayasuriya as he tries to jab it into the off side
boom. Much straighter now, on middle and off, and there was a bit of air on it. Just cleared his front leg and launched it high over wide long-on
back of a length outside off and Jayasuriya plays what looks like one of his favourite shots, waits on it and dabs it towards third man. His name is Jayasuriya but this shot is pure Ranatunga
there it is again, uses the pace and angle to dab that late but this time hits it straight to short third man
nice flight, drops shorter than Jayasuriya expected after he came down the track, and it went with the angle to hit his pads as he tried to whip it into the leg side
stays on the back foot this time, lets it come on, uses the angle to work it into the midwicket region
down the track comes Siriwardana, gets to the pitch and stays inside the line and steers it towards sweeper cover with a slightly open face
good stuff from Malik, sees Jayasuriya coming and fires it full and flat. Can only jab it back to the bowler
down the track again and this time he timed his dance down the pitch to perfection. It was flighted, and he met it on the full to launch it sweetly over wide long-off
quicker now, stays back but has no room, pushes it to short cover
back of a length, angling into the body, tucked away nicely towards deep midwicket, put just enough weight on that shot to be able to pick up two
shortish outside off, didn't pick the slower ball, and it beats his edge as he tries to slash it through point
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, and Jayasuriya pops it straight to short extra cover. Makes room to slash it over the off side, doesn't time it well enough and gets no elevation
back of a length, angling across. Looks to dab it to third man with an open face, ball slides past his edge
fullish on leg stump, tickled away into the vacant space to the left of the keeper. Maybe there was no bat on it, just pad
slower ball outside off, perfect length for Siriwardana to clear his front leg and launch it down the ground. Makes decent contact with it, just decent enough to clear long-on
flat, angling into the right hander as he shuffles down the pitch. No room for an attacking shot, and he clips it down towards long-on
flat again, on leg stump, tucked off the pads through backward square leg
a bit more flight, on off stump, driven to extra cover

back of a length, skids with the angle towards off stump. Leans back and makes room to dab it to short third man, and the non-striker called early and sprinted quickly through to the other end. They check with the third umpire anyway, but he made his crease long before Rizwan collected the throw and disturbed the bails
quickish length ball on off stump, pushed to mid-off
length ball slanted across the left-hander, who goes for the slog-sweep from outside off, ends up inside-edging it into his pads
full, angling down leg, and Kapugedera gets down low and uses the angle to sweep him firmly to the left of the short fine leg fielder
length ball on middle stump, just pushes it with a straight bat down to long-on. There's a fumble from the fielder but they only take one
there's the quick offbreak, angling across towards off stump. Stays back and punches down to long-off
fullish, angling into off stump, comes forward and pushes it towards point
length ball on off stump, just goes with the angle. Pushes to long-on again, but uses his wrists to place it wide of the fielder this time, and picks up two
fuller now, on middle stump, stretches forward and drives it back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, makes a bit of room but can't steer it past backward point
length ball again, but this time a bit of width, slices it away to deep point
and that's an excellent bouncer. Quick, angling into the batsman, and Kapugedera can only duck under it
back of a length outside off, looked like a slower ball, doesn't really time the pull, but gets it into the gap between short midwicket and deep square leg
ooh, he's just cleared backward point. That was short and angling into him. Tried to make room and it followed him in, and he s
full outside off, stays back and opens his bat face to steer it to third man
slower ball outside off, and Siriwardana clears his front leg to try and launch it down the ground. Didn't spot the change of pace and swung and missed
another slower ball, shortish, angling into the body. Comes down the track, and chops it down towards extra cover
short on middle stump, pulled to deep square leg
another slower ball outside off. Shuffles across and swipes it towards backward square leg
down the track, and that is nicely done. Spotted the shortish slower ball, held his shape nicely, and swung his arms through the line to hit it over long-on
full and wide and he slices it in the air towards deep extra cover
full and wide again, maybe looking for the wide yorker, ends up going past the wide tramline

this time he gets the wide yorker right. Jams down on it and the ball bounces slowly towards the bowler, who runs through quickly in his follow-through to try and run out the non-striker as they try to steal a single. They manage it, just about. Anwar's throw just misses off stump, and Kapugedera dives in. Would have been out had he hit
slower bouncer outside off, miscues the pull, goes uppishly but bounces down in front of deep square leg
length ball wide of off stump, opens his bat face and guides it to deep point

slower short ball on off stump, pulled down to long-on, and it takes its time getting to the fielder, Umar Akmal. They sprint hard for a second, and make it because Akmal's throw, to the keeper's end, wasn't powerful enough
slower ball, and it ends up as a low full-toss on middle stump. Kapugedera clears his front leg and smacks it hard over wide long-on. That brings up the 50 partnership
slower ball and this time Siriwardana can't clear the boundary. It was a little shorter than ideal to be hitting down the ground, and he ends up spooning it straight to long-off
short ball and that's a lucky boundary for Kapugedera. Was hurried by the short one from around the wicket, and late on his pull. Ended up top-edging it over the keeper, into the third man boundary

length ball outside off and that is another boundary. This time goes where he intended. Clears his front leg a touch and scoops it over mid-off. Clears him, and that may have hit the boundary on the full. Didn't quite middle it, but yes, it's just about gone all the way
yorker on middle and leg, clipped away towards deep midwicket
full on off stump, punched hard down the ground to long-off, stayed in the air for a little while
short ball, angling into the body. Late on the pull and it smacks him on the stomach. The batsmen manage to sneak a leg-bye by the time Irfan can get to the ball and bend down to pick it up
slower ball wide outside off and that is superb placement. First boundary for Shanaka, gets down low, on one knee, and sweeps into the gap between long-on and deep midwicket
yorker on middle stump, clipped down to long-on
full-toss on off stump, and Kapugedera simply strolls across his stumps and picks it up, casually, just whips his wrists to clear deep backward square leg with ease
off-stump yorker, and he tries to make room and jab it into the off side, can only squeeze it slowly into the leg side, off the inside edge
length ball on off stump, makes some room and slaps it down to sweeper cover
slower ball outside off and Kapugedera slogs and misses. Rolls down to the keeper, who takes out the stumps with a bullet throw to run out Shanaka as they try to steal a bye
